data.title: Terminal run selection using powershell should run selection as a block, not as individual lines

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When running text selection in the integrated terminal, when it finishes and goes back to the prompt it is adding a new line. You have to backspace back up. 

Before

``` powershell
PS C:\>
```

After

``` powershell
PS C:\>
>>
```
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insiders 7/25, but has been around for several builds
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. run selection in terminal on windows
2.

data.title: Add file to gitignore
data.body:
This is a feature request for Git. 

Frequently (on a mac) I get this pesky .DS_Store file showing up. I see it then add it to my .gitignore. What would be great is a menu item to add a file to gitignore. An [extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=michelemelluso.gitignore) exists to do this and I think it would be great to add the functionality to the git context menu. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/17113077/d76cd67a-525d-11e6-8e24-253cf4265d09.png)

data.title: Incrementally post-process unsorted results
VSCode failing to launch external program npm in 1.3.1
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.1

I have the following task set up that I have been using for quite a while to run a few different npm scripts

```
// A task runner for npm scripts
{
  "command": "npm",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "showOutput": "always",
  "args": ["run"],
  "isWatching": false,
  "tasks": [
    { "taskName": "build" },
    { "taskName": "watch"   },
    { "taskName": "watch:all"   }
  ]
}
```

this has worked well for me across several versions of vscode, but on Friday when I upgraded to 1.3.1 I started getting the following error when trying to start any of these tasks

```
Failed to launch external program npm run.
spawn npm ENOENT
```

Nothing has changed wrt to my npm version/installation path. Any suggestions for getting this working again?

data.title: Detect shebang for Groovy files
data.body:
- Should match "#!groovy", "#!/usr/bin/env /path/to/groovy" & "#!/usr/bin/groovy" types
- Very useful for people editing Jenkinsfile configuration (which has no file extension) and hopefully others too

data.title: Max-width autocomplete does max-height instead
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 build 10586.494

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In a sass file, type 'maxw' and press enter
2. Snippet expands to max-height instead of max width

data.title: openNativeConsole cannot have Custom Keybinding
data.body:
Because of issue #7904 I was needing to set a different keybinding for openNativeConsole. However, it is not respecting the keybinding being set in keybindings.json. No matter what I try to set ctrl+shift+c remains the keybinding.

This may also be happening with ctrl+shift+v and preview.
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insiders 7/25
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set a new keybinding for openNativeConsole
2. test copying text in the console input.

data.title: sticky TabMovesFocus config
data.body:
### Steps to Reproduce (1/2)
- enable workbench tab (`showTabs`)
- have two editor columns, editors in each
- run the `Keyboard Shortcuts` config action
- select `Cmd+1` to focus column #1
- select a different writable editor in that column
- 💥 tab moves focus
### Steps to Reproduce (2/2)
1. Have a 2 pane layout.
2. Hit <kbd>Cmd ,</kbd> to open user settings.
3. Hit <kbd>Cmd 1</kbd> to focus the first pane.
4. Use quick open to switch to an editable file.
5. Hit <kbd>Cmd 2</kbd> to focus the user settings and make any **valid** change there.
6. Hit <kbd>Cmd 1</kbd> to focus the first pane.

<kbd>Tab</kbd> will now focus away from the editor instead of inserting a `TAB`.

data.title: Can't copy text in integrated terminal input field
data.body:
when you try to copy text in the input field for the integrated terminal it does not register the terminal as being selected. Instead it launches an external terminal. If I highlight text inside of the terminal ctrl+shift+c works as expected.

``` json
{ "key": "ctrl+shift+c",          "command": "workbench.action.terminal.copySelection",
                                     "when": "terminalFocus" },
{ "key": "ctrl+shift+c",          "command": "workbench.action.terminal.openNativeConsole",
                                     "when": "!terminalFocus" }
```

It is registering as if the terminal is not selected.
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insiders 7/25
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select text in the integrated terminal input field 
2. ctrl + c erases text and gives you ^C
3. ctrl + shift + c opens an external terminal

data.title: Test: API - support for document link provider
data.body:
Test for #1805:
- [x] any os - **@waderyan**
- [x] macOS - **@weinand**

We added new api that allows to [register link providers](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L3814) for documents. Verify that
- the API makes sense and fits into the `languages` namespace
- the API docs makes sense
- there is always the default link provider (works for http, https, and file schemas)
- cases when links touch or intersect are resolved by using the link from the [higher](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L3606) ranked provider
- for advanced cases there is a command `vscode.executeLinkProvider` that allows to retrieve the same data the UI uses

data.title: Test: API - support group ordering for menu contributions
data.body:
Test for #9153:
- [x] any os - **@chrisdias**
- [x] macOS - **@weinand**

When using the [`menuitems`](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/extension-points#_contributesmenus) contribution point, you can control the order of menu items and of menu item groups. Verify that:
- groups are sorted lexicographically - except for the `navigation` group which comes first always
- menu items are sorted lexicographically when they just specify a group. When the group matches a  pattern like `some_group@10` the number used to promote/demote the item.

data.title: Test: Evaluate API gaps for better VIM support
data.body:
Test for #8997:
- [x] Any OS (Linux) - **@Tyriar**
## Set up
- Clone the repository [VS Code Extension Samples](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples)
- Go to the folder **vim-sample** and do npm install
- Open VS Code on **vim-sample**
- Run the extension using Launch Extension. 

This will run Vim sample extension and is referred as Vim editor from here after. Verify following scenarios on this. 
## Good to know
- Vim editor has basically 3 modes: `Normal`, `Visual`, `Edit`.
### Mode change
- Press `i` for edit mode when in normal or visual mode.
- Press `esc` for normal node when in edit mode.
- Press `v` for visual mode when in normal mode.
### Line vs wrapped line

A line is a complete line that can consists of one or more wrapped lines in the screen.

**Note**: All of these scenarios have to be tested in **non-edit mode**
## Test Cursor movements

When cursor is in wrapped line then typing...
### Test left - right motions
- `g0`: Moves to beginning
- `vg0`: Selects till beginning
- `g^: Moves to first non white space character
- `vg^`: Selects till first non white space character
- `g$`: Moves to end
- `vg$`: Selects till end
- `g_`: Moves to last non white space character
- `vg_`: Selects till last non white space character
- `gm`: Moves to center
- `vgm`: Selects till center
### Test up - down motions (Where `n` is a number variable and default is 1)
- `ngk`Move up n wrapped lines
- `nvgk`Select till n wrapped lines up
- `ngj`Move down n wrapped lines
- `nvgj`Select till n wrapped lines down
- `nH` Move to first non white space character of nth line from the top of the view
- `nvH` Select till first non white space character of nth line from the top of the view
- `nL` Move to first non white space character of nth line from the bottom of the view
- `nvL` Select till first non white space character of nth line from the bottom of the view
- `nM` Move to first non white space character of center line of the view
- `nvM` Select till first non white space character of center line of the view
## Test Tab motions

In Normal / Visual mode, typing `:` will open an Input box. In the input box, type and test following for current active editor

**Note**: For convenience, input box is pre-filled with value `tabm`.
### When tabs are enabled
- `tabm` Moves to last position in its group
- `tabm{n}` Moves to position `n` in its group. Default is 0.
- `tabm>{n}` Moves to right by `n` positions in its group. Default is 1.
- `tabm<{n}` Moves to left by `n` positions in its group. Default is 1.
- `tabm>>` Moves to last position in its group.
- `tabm<<` Moves to last position in its group.
- `tabm.` Moves to center of its group. Default is 1.
### When tabs are disabled

**Note:** `0`: Left, `1`:Center, `2`:Right
- `tabm`, `tabm>`, `tabm>>` Moves to `Right` group
- `tabm<`, `tabm<<` Moves to `Left` group
- `tabm.` Moves to `Center` group
- `tabm{n}` Moves to group `n`. Default is `Right`.
## Known bugs
- #9732
- #9542

data.title: Test: Support tab completion for snippets
data.body:
Test for #9579:
- [x] Windows - **@egamma**
- [x] OS X - **@joaomoreno**
- [x] Linux - **@aeschli**

There is a new configuration property `editor.tabCompletion` which defaults to `false`. When set to `true` verify that
- pressing the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key when the cursor follows a snippet prefix expands the snippet
- reason about the name of this setting (`tabCompletion`) - rationale was that folks know this feature as _tab completion_
- make sure things are live: run the `Preferences: Snippet` to define a new snippet and make sure it works without restart
- use prefixes with non-word characters like `c'l` and make sure it works

data.title: Test: Provide a separate 'Insert snippet' command that allows the user to pick a snippet
data.body:
Test for #9072, #9122, #6320, #9286:
- [x] Windows - **@DonJayamanne**
- [x] OS X - **@Tyriar**
- [x] Linux - **@kieferrm**

There is a new command to insert snippets. Verify that
- there is a _Show Snippets_ command in `F1`, and that
- it does what you expect

data.title: Test: Provide a setting to define the snippet sort order
data.body:
Test for #9072, #9122, #6320, #9286:
- [x] Windows - **@ramya-rao-a**
- [x] OS X - **@Tyriar**
- [x] Linux - **@chrmarti**

We have a new setting `editor.snippetSuggestions` which allows to control how snippets work. Verify that:
- you can define how snippets are sorted (`top`, `bottom`, `inline`)
- you can define to not show snippets (`none`)
- you can intellisense et al when configuring the setting
- the config is live and doesn't require a restart

data.title: Test: Integrated terminal IME support
data.body:
Test for #7045:
- [x] Windows - **@rebornix**
- [x] OS X - **@kieferrm**
- [x] Linux - **@joaomoreno**

The integrated terminal now supports input via IMEs  (Input Method Editors). During development I tested this across all 3 OS' with Japanese and Korean IMEs as I'm familiar with them. Here are some things to try:
- Install/enable an IME for the OS, preferably not Japanese/Korean
- Test input, if you're familiar with the IME try all the edge cases
  - Multiple character compositions?
  - Multiple keystrokes per character?
  - Multiple characters reducing to a single character?
- Test executing a command using the text (eg. `echo`)

See https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/pull/175 for more details on the change and testing that was performed at implementation time.

data.title: Test: 'Restart Frame'
data.body:
Test for #9145:
- [x] any OS - **@DonJayamanne**

VS Code now has a 'Restart Frame' action in the stack frame context menu in the CALL STACK viewlet. 
'Restart Frame' is only available for debug extensions that support this functionality, e.g. VS Code's builtin **Node Debug**. 

Verify that:
- it restarts execution of the selected stack frame
- that the VARIABLES and CALL STACK view update correctly
- that the editor shows the current line in the correct color.

Please note: make sure to use a node.js version >= 5.11 since 'Restart Frame' does not work in all situations for older version of node (see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9483)

data.title: onClick for TextDecorations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
How can I handle onClick events on TextDecorations?  

TextDecorations can show hover information, but I cannot add a custom handler for onClick events.
Using onDidChangeTextEditorSelection to determine which decoration was clicked on is not a very nice solution and does not trigger the immediately.

data.title: Default to generic icon for extensions that do not have custom icons
data.body:
> This request comes from the Marketplace team.

Need to send additional json data as request body:

```
"assetTypes":["Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default"]
```

And add additional flag `0x02` to the current flags(this means include files). This would return the icon file as part of response if it exists.

For example current body for call from VS code will change to:

```
{"assetTypes":["Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default"], "filters":[{"criteria":[{"filterType":1,"value":"vscode"}]}],"flags":391}
```

data.title: "Check For Updates" doesn't show anything if no editor window opened
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.3.1
- OS Version:
  MacOS 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VS Code.
2. Close all editor windows.
3. From the toolbar select "Code" → "Check For Updates...".

Nothing will be shown, as it looks like, informational popups only work inside the editor window.
